html:
** Shares of British software company AVV.L rise as high as 2.4% to 3,775p, highest since April 27

** HSBC upgrades to "buy" from "hold" rating, citing valuation; lifts PT to 4,345p from 3,870p

** Brokerage says the combination of new CEO and revenue from the OSIsoft acquisition should boost growth

** AVV on April 27 said its CEO Craig Hayman was stepping down for personal reasons and would be replaced by Peter Herweck (Full Story)

** OSIsoft acquistion could be the 'impetus' to drive underlying growth rather than the multi-year contracts which have driven growth in last few years - HSBC

** Brokerage raises co's EPS estimates to 12% and 17% for FY22 and FY23, respectively

** Of 15 brokerages, twelve rate the stock "buy" or higher, three "hold"; median PT is 4,080p - Refinitiv data

** AVV up 15.18% YTD as of last close


(Reporting by Siddarth S)

(( Siddarth.s@thomsonreuters.com ;))
